alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Inland; Escambia; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 1:52PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Monroe, north central Baldwin and northwestern Escambia Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 151 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Poarch Creek Reservation, or 10 miles northwest of Atmore, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... McCullough and Poarch Creek Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
